reviews.text: I was there for art walk & enjoyed it.
Walking through the park....taking in the sights and sounds....surrounded by wonderful people and beautiful works of art....had a marvelous time! Would love to visit again when I'm in town!
It was a very nice place what number is a lot of homeless people there listen to our hearts I guess I got to be somewhere
Nice place to hang out the monthly artwalk is here every once in a while
The people that feed other people...are a true blessing, with many Angels among those with needs, good bless them, & there families. For their efforts.... Amen

This church is very beautiful. We shoot wedding videos there often and it is both a great place to work and to have a wedding. The lighting is not great for video, but the building's beauty more than makes up for it. The choir here always does a great job and we appreciate that they are located in a second story choir loft. The wedding coordinator here is also very agreeable to work with.
Such a beautiful mass. The alter was full of Christmas trees with white lights and 50 pots of Poinsettia s and a beautiful manger.
Ash Wednesday mass was refreshing.  Met several people . Parking was full.
Always a great place to attend mass at.
It's beautiful and Fr. Jose is AWESOME!

Very nice way to remember an icon in the Hispanic community, a daughter of this wonderful city. I never knew her music, but one can see the love of her family and fans in this installation at the base of the People's St. T-head. The statue is nice and I enjoyed hearing the looping recording. This very cool to see and it's free of charge. A quick visit by the water. It is a quick visit however it is nice to learn about the locals.

A cool tribute to the slain singer. It is located in a beautiful location right next to the water. I had a meeting nearby and decided to walk over since I didn’t know how parking would be near the memorial. I came to find out it is not an issue to park down there so I probably should have driven.

Definitely worth a visit.

Selena's memorial is so beautiful. I felt it very peaceful. My mom and girls went there to place white roses. I love how the wind and the sound of the nearby waves made her spirit still so alive. Very memorable experience. It's gated but well kept.

That was cool.  We got to talk to a guy who claimed to be Selena's neighbor.  We had nice conversation.  We was kind of a history guide.  Very grateful to be there and talk to people about her.  It was nice.

Very nice way to remember an icon in the Hispanic community, a daughter of this wonderful city. I never knew her music, but one can see the love of her family and fans in this installation at the base of the People's St. T-head. The statue is nice and I enjoyed hearing the looping recording.

What an incredible piece of history this is. The location is easy, no problem with the parking lot. The ship is rock, this what made the history. There are so much to learn, a perfect way to spend your day. By the way, lots of steep stairwells to go up and down so keep that in mind for walking shoes/dressing comfortably. I love the place what awesome experiences.

Awesome place to learn about our Navy history. This ship museum has a lot to offer for site seeing. Our children enjoyed it a lot. They have everything displayed very well and even have the descriptions readable.

The food area is a little expensive but that is expected.

The bathrooms are on the second deck of the ship and you have to climb down a tight stair way. 

If you're six foot and taller watch your head. The ship has some low places that you bump your head pretty good if you're not paying attention. 

If you have a baby in a stroller there some area you cannot take the stroller through. So make sure you have your baby back pack carrier ready available. Upon arriving you can choose to walk or wait for the cart service to pick you up.

The souvenir shop is really nice and has a lot of goodies for everyone.

Enjoy your time while visiting here!

The entrance fee was not bad and it takes an easy 3 to 4 hours to do the tours without spending a lot of time reading at the exhibits. They also have lots of movies etc. It is a great way to pay respects to all members of the military especially the Navy and our WWII vets. Go and see this you will not be disappointed.

So where do I begin? Well the experience was fantastic. The employees and the tour guides were knowledgeable about the location of certain things and also about the ship. The tours were an A+, 10/10 stars. Really loved the new renovated Lexington. Food was so good as well. We didn't have a single problem, period. I really enjoyed the escape room and the objectives it presented. Real nice touch of excitement to the entire experience.

Great experience! Enjoyed the escape room. Loved all the airplanes and history. The 3D movie was entertaining. The food was good, really enjoyed the onion rings. The food in the galley looked real. A full day of fun and learning.

My wife and I took my daughter on a campus visit this weekend.  My daughter loved the school and has the school on her list along with Colorado State among others.

I on the other hand was somewhat disappointed.  It was just not a very welcoming experience.  The students that were providing the various tours were polite enough but it wasn’t really a,” Welcome to aTm! We are so glad that you’re considering us!”.  Instead it was, “Howdy, consider yourself fortunate enough if you are accepted.”. 

I’ve been to plenty of campuses to include CU (Boulder), UT (Austin), Baylor (Waco), UCSB (Santa Barbara), etc.  Some campus visits required a fee but they also provided meals, parking and swag.  They gave you the feeling of belonging and you wanted to enroll there.  

aTm on the other hand wanted to show how big they were, how much everything would cost and if you wanted to visit various areas of the campus, they made a profit by charging you parking at every opportunity.  

I was slightly surprised as you would think the 3rd largest university in the country would have the assets to provide parking waivers or a day pass for visiting parents.

The amenities and facilities were very nice and what you would expect from a top tier university.  The campus was clean and various construction was occurring to indicate growth.

We were slightly surprised that the campus was beginning to feel cramped as it appears they had surrounding acreage to expand.  

With that being said, the nursing school did seem to be a good distance from the main campus.  So they might be working on this type of expansion.

As a helpful suggestion, offer parking passes to registered visitors (even if they have to pay for it). Along with google links to the various schools of interest for visitors.  As Google maps has not been updated in some time and some of the college of study were outdated.  (This might be something the computer science students could work on?)
I loved my time at A&M. There’s nothing like an Aggie football game

Texas A&M University, referred to as TAMU. Founded in 1876, the school is located in Card City, Texas, USA, a member of the top 100 universities in the world, and the American Association of Universities (AAU), the leading research university alliance in North America. The sixth largest public university in the United States has a high academic achievement and teaching standards.
Texas A&M University has the nation's top engineering school and is known worldwide. 2018 USNEWS National Engineering Institute ranked 12th among them: 2nd in petroleum engineering, 3rd in biological and agricultural engineering, 3rd in nuclear engineering, 7th in aerospace engineering, 13th in industrial and systems engineering, civil engineering 15th, mechanical engineering 16th, computer science 17th, the rest of the engineering profession is also among the best.
Texas A&M University's research in basic sciences is also particularly remarkable. Many Nobel laureates have worked or studied here: organic chemistry master Derek Barton has worked here for twelve years and has become a conformational analysis and The main founder of free radical chemistry; Jack Kirby, the father of integrated circuits, is a Distinguished Professor of the School of Electrical Engineering. The famous JK proactor is named after him; Dudley Herschbach et al. The chemical element reaction system won the 1986 Nobel Prize in Chemistry. In addition, TAMU is known for its cutting-edge scientific cloning technology. The first cloned cat and cloned dog in human history are the results of the school.
The school is not only strong in engineering and basic science, but also in the leading position in the emerging fields of accounting, management, and art: 13 in architecture, 15 in accounting, and 20 in urban planning.
In 2018, Texas A&M University ranked 57th in the ARWU North American University of Shanghai Jiaotong University [1], USNEWS ranked 16th in North American universities, ranked 42nd in LeagueTables global universities , CWUR World University ranked 78, North American universities 45 people.
This school scks full of snobby ppl

FISHERY AT BLUE HERON BRIDGE INTENTIONALLY DESTROYED! by Moody Gardens and Texas A&M Blue Heron Bridge, is a world renowned dive site loved by locals This establishment went to collect a sizeable amount of fish and other specimens from one of the best dive sites in Florida, the Blue Heron Bridge. They have destroyed the site Shame on you Texas A&M

We were recommended to go to Blackbeard’s today and I must say, I’m impressed. Atmosphere was good, waitress was excellent, food was amazing! Not disappointed at all! Prices were just right. If you want great food for a good price get you some Blackbeard’s.
Staff was welcoming. Had a great food/drink selection. Didn't wait long before our food popped up. The cocktails and dessert just made the meal an experience.

Plenty of seating in a quieter area or next to loud music if you prefer. The food tasted great and out quickly. Unfortunately, the baked potato (which was fully cooked) was cold. They traded it for a hot one. I'll definitely be back.

We walked over from our hotel and that was a plus! I had the Blackbeard burger which was delicious with fries. We also had beef nachos also very good and key lime pie yum!! Drinks were strong and we asked for them to lighten them up which they did. There was live music which we enjoyed! Stopped in with friends for drinks and appetizers. Good service and reasonable pricing. Tried a couple of appetizers and they were very good.

If you come here get the shrimp! It’s so delicious with their seasoning and juicy. The best shrimp I’ve ever had! Their burgers are also great, juicy and cooked just right. A real hidden gem, and fast service!

My husband and I have been living in Anchorage for a few months now and had never been to this diner.  You walk in an immediately get the feel of the 1940s and 50’s vibe. The music the malt shake bar, the wonderful service from staff. The cook from the kitchen always had a smile on his face. The food was wonderful, I had the chili burger and my husband had the Route 66 burger! Highly recommend.

So my wife and I had never been to this diner.  You walk in an immediately get the old timey diner theme. The malt shake bar, the wonderful service from staff was great! The food was wonderful. I had the 66 burger, and I would recommend getting that if you like a good burger!

The staff is always friendly, the portions are filling and they've got tons of booths.  Stopped by and found out the restaurant had changed hands.  Not a bad thing at all.  Still super friendly, our server Allison was so happy and on the ball.  Food arrived very quickly and was very tasty.

I can't believe I passed this diner so many times without ever going in there. The corned beef is amazing! It's REAL shredded corned beef! The food quality is way above what I expect from any diner and the prices are excellent here as well! The menu is far better than I expected as well. Inside is very clean and very nice! This is my new favourite place! You won't regret trying this place out.

Great food and service. 
Sat down and within 20 minutes we had our food at the table. 
Lovely retro feels and great malt and shake choices.

The server may have forgotten us.  Manager was more than generous.  The foods may have been waiting for us in the back but was just not brought out.  The food was delicious.  I guess this is what happen in an AWESOME and in high demand place is like.  Prepare to be in for a while.   Will definitely give it another try in the summer.

Server didn't pay much attention. Later she had a large table but no reason to neglect. I had to go to the count to check out. 
As far as the food I had a fiesta burger, the taste was great but it should have been on hamburger buns not bread. 
I will return but will not get the same food item.

We stopped in for dinner on our way home from the airport around 730ish. It was a Friday, so we expected a wait. It only took about 5 minutes before we were seated. The live music kept us entertained while we made our dinner choices. The clam chowder was excellent. We both agreed we should have gotten bowls instead of the cups. We both ordered the Seafood Lover's platter. One would have been enough to feed both of us. I shared mine with our son and we still ended up taking home enough to make a meal for one. The service was fast and friendly. We were in and out in less than an hour. The desserts looked tasty, but we were to full. Maybe next time!

I've been coming here a few years with hit or miss on the service on our vacations.  This time was fantastic. Our waitress was on top of everything. She was polite and friendly the whole time. The manager even stopped by the table. Our food was delicious. Definitely would recommend coming here. I especially love watching the sun setting on a chilly night... absolutely breathtaking.
*I had more food on my plate, this was after my daughter had taken some.

GREAT FOOD!!! 
service was good, not great. But to be fair they were getting slammed so I should say it was very very good considering the volume at the time. 
I had catch of the day Red Fish in a crawfish sauce and it was amazing. 
Price was reasonable.

Love this place! We had the queso and chips. It was so good and had a twist to it. The fries were thin and scrumptious. The burgers were  cooked a little to well for me. So be sure to specify. Ample seating..love the people.  Warm friendly and just a neat place to go. We missed the live music.. and it was cold but the have the heaters and the area was perfect. It is a must down town.

If you’re visiting from out of town, The Executive Surf Club, is local restaurant that provides live music and relaxing beach vibe. There is indoor and outdoor seating. There is a child’s menu and they’re pet friendly! The Scarecrow People are a must see! The menu is pretty good and decently priced. On Monday nights the host “Geeks Who Drink”, tons of fun if you’re into trivia.
Venue was awesome and live band performance was so much fun. Great beer selection inside but not great service. A lot of fun for a new experience.

Very fun bar and American restaurant with a ton of beers on tap. They've got a good kitchen too, I really liked my Southwest burger, and the fries are excellent. If you have a dog you can sit outside on their porch area and listen to the live music as well.

I’m guessing this place is hyped-up as a ‘Corpus Classic’, and by classic meaning “subpar food pretending to be good food”

1. If I bring the chips back because they weren’t cooked all the way, don’t send them back to me a minute shy of being burnt..

2. If you’re going to fry food, you might as well use fresh oil. Our fries, onion rings, chips, and pickles all tasted of burnt, rancid oil..

3. If you’re going to put a menu above your register, maybe advertise all your menu items?..

Maybe all this was a factor of it being a Sunday? Maybe it was a bad staff? Maybe it’s the weather?

Maybe it’s me. But when the food is so bad it makes your beer taste bad... the restaurant is headed in a bad direction.

1 Star- Justified by the restaurant’s lackluster performance and underwhelming experience.
I've been coming here for years and the food has been good every time. Very consistent.  Had to wait a few minutes to get a table but still got in quick. Good place check it out
One of my top places for tasty Chinese food. Came in on a Weds. The service was very welcoming and observant. Prices were reasonable.
Very good Chinese food. Always fresh. The waite staff is friendly.
I've been going to this restaurant for years. I love them!! The food is delicious and made to order. So it's fresh and hot.
Fresh fresh fresh is all I have to say great food  🍲🥗🥣

By far theee best Italian food I had in a long while. Everything is had was amazing. The environment is very friendly. The wait service is extremely knowledgeable on there food and service. I really wanted the veal but the staff recommend the Italian sampler. Which feature all of the known dishes. We also had the Italian chicken wings as an appetizer. You can not go wrong eating here, unless you don't have any taste buds. Come with an an empty stomach. There portions are plenty.

Island Italian Restaurant is located on North Padre Island, TX.  A family owned restaurant which suffered severe damage during Hurricane Harvey,l. Recently re opened after being closed for 14 months.
The food is authentic Italian food and absolutely wonderful. Visiting the Island for the Winter from  Illinois. WELCOME BACK,  Tony. Much continued good luck .

I liked it overall! I ordered a Reuben sandwich for $6.99 came with a bag of $.50 chips and a sandwich with 3 slices of roast beef, on a piece of toasted Italian bread.. the roast beef's grease leaked out onto the bread and plate. Different kinda Reuben is all. It was good! Atmosphere was great. Make co-worker really liked the lasagna plate.. 
I'm gonna go back for sure... lots to order on the menu.. 😀
Food was great! Prices reasonable. Atmosphere pleasant. Looks can be deceiving tho. If you think the full parking lot means a full restaurant, don't worry. It's huge inside! Plenty of seating.

I've been coming here for years and finally went back since they re-opened after the hurricane. I must say, the gentleman serving us must have been having a bad day, because service left something to be desired. But, they still get 5 stars because the food was worth it. It's THAT good. Best pepperoni rolls in town.

Atmosphere was great!! The remodeling looks fantastic! The service was amazing. Our waiter John was attentive yet never intrusive.  I know everyone visits Niko's for their steaks,  but I had heard their chicken tenders were amazing. I was blown away! Hands down the best chicken tenders I've ever had.  The mac n cheese was delicious as well!! I was a little disappointed in the black and blue ribeye. I personally love steaks grilled on an open flame and expect for it to taste like it was cooked on an open flame.  This steak tasted like it was cooked on an iron skillet and tossed on the grill for a few seconds.  I've had several streaks here before that were phenomenal so I was slightly disappointed.  But the chicken strips are worth a visit to this establishment!

They needs some improvement on the vegetable dishes to much oil use.  All vegetables need is just a little saute and seasoning. Just a little salt. The fish portions are way to small for the price. For a restaurant in this location the food should be better. The steak is always rough not mouth watering tender like it should be. The cheese cakes are a joke.  It's more like pudding cheese cake. You can get better cheese cake from Walmart, Heb, or even a gas station. They do have good drinks.

Ordered the ribeye with loaded baked potato, green beans, and Malibu fried shrimp. Steak was good but not worth the 45 minutes it took to get. The shrimp was perfectly cooked and the green beans were fantastic. Only gave three stars because of the long wait for food and the fact that the bar does not have any beer on tap.
Great service from our waiter. He was a military veteran and it shows, the attention to detail was awesome. He also made great drink suggestions, and our food was delicious as always

The food was delicious.  Out quickly for the most part considering most steakhouses take a while.  The waiter unfortunately was monotone, didnt feel excited to be there, and difficult to hear.  He did however stay attentive to our needs and did his job.

Visiting from Austin, was pleased with the service and the food quality.  The kids loved their meat ball and turkey subs.  Bread were crunchy.  Pizzas were great.  Even have quit few beers on tap.  For touristy places, restaurant with good quality of food are hard to find.  Enjoyed our lunch very much.  and the restroom is clean.
Great, quick service. A basket of bread is served after you're seated. Beer and wine available. Family friendly. Pizza was good and affordable. We enjoyed the Greek pizza. Thank you!

Our waitress was nice and the pizza was good, but don't order the wings. We got our order of wings and but into them to find they were still frozen. Not good it made my stomach hurt so we couldn't finish the pizza.

The best pizza in Corpus that we have found.  The hand tossed crust is outstanding, good quality and quantity of cheese and the topping are good.  While the topping are not as substantial as Grimaldi's, the price is good and the toppings are more than just good.good. 

The wait staff is young and sometimes disorganized, but very friendly and eager to please.

Great pizza and service! We were just looking for good pizza with a nice atmosphere and Padre Pizzeria definitely gave us that! We had the Veggie Galore pizza with hand-tossed crust which was amazing! Beer was available in bottles but not on tap.

Nice variety on the menu, vegan options for my GF and a nice Reuben for me, well proportioned Rueben, some delis pile on too much Corned beef thinking that is better, but I just want a normal sized sandwich that is easy to eat and finish, that tastes great. This was.

These is my all time favorite best Seafood salad, Must try Banana Foster pie is to die for. I will even drive from Kingsville to Corpus just to go get the salad, trio salad tuna, greens, Seafood salad and don't firget the pie

Food was so so.
Only got soup..nothing special. Desserts looked yummy, but did not get anything as I am a diabetic.
Cute, modern cafe/deli. Food and drinks were great.
Always great food and friendly service!

If you like Thai food. This is the place for you. The staff is very friendly and very attentive. The food is delicious and you can choose your heat . The menu is wide with choices of appetizers and lots of dinner choices. We like the chicken dumplings as an appetizer. They gave a great and reasonable lunch menu as well.

We have been here several times. They have a lunch menu which is less than $10.00. I ordered the peanut sauce over chicken. It comes with a choice of soup or salad. The soup was a flavorful chicken and vegetable soup. You also receive a spring roll which has a good flavor. Service is fast and friendly. Plenty of people working which helps if you have a time limit at lunch.
Amazing food for a great price. Love the chicken sauté and Tiger Cry when ordering. Little to no wait when dining in and pick up times are quick. Service is always polite and professional.

I recently just tried this place for the first time and the food was amazing!! The service is very friendly and welcoming and the atmosphere is great. I would totally recommend this for a lunch or dinner stop
This place has amazing food. I tried the pineapple Curry and boyfriend had the yellow curry both were delicious! I would highly recommend this place!

I love the food here! Great tasting and healthy choices. I've had ALMOST everything o the menu and haven't been disappointed yet. The staff is always willing to help you decide on what's good too. The owner is a great person! I personally recommend the rice bowls and the hummus. The soups are really good to and the wraps are great. I was surprised to find that I really liked the veggie pizza too! My 3 yr old even loves to go to Urban Fare. ;-)

They really need to use the numbering system they have. They kept losing track of who ordered what and we ended up waiting quite a while just for the soup alone. And then the sandwiches came immediately afterwards. At least they tried to make it up to us.
Great food and service! This place is a jewel here and I wish there were more places like it

I ate here for dinner on Monday, May 21, 2012.  You go up to a counter, order your food, then sit down and they bring it to you.  It has a hip, healthy eating atmosphere.  There are a ton of food choices, from soups and salads, to grilled cheese, wraps, and pizza, also many tasty looking deserts.  I ordered the mediterranean pizza and hummus dip.  Both here freshly made and delicious.  The tandoori chicken wrap is supposedly chicken tikka masala in a wrap.  I will get that next time.  Relaxed, calm atmosphere.  There was lots of good looking stuff on the menu.

This place is amazing! I had some of the best raw Gulf oysters I have ever tasted! Plump, sweet, and fresh! Then my oyster Po boy was equally amazing. And my server Rita was friendly and attentive. Fabulous experience overall!

Our first visit was great.  We loved everything about this place. Most of all my Rockefeller oysters were on point. Thanks for a great wait staff, cleanly neat and quick service. We will definitely be back. Thanks Corpus Christi

Tried the brunch, I do not recommend it. I had to ask for the brunch menu, because it was not given to us when we sat down.  Brunch menu offered 5 different types of Eggs Benedict, which was nice. They also offered a French toast and an omelette. My group and I ordered every  Egg Benedict on the menu, because we were able to choose two different ones for one order, which was nice also. Now for the disappointment. Almost every single egg for our Eggs Benedict were hard boiled not poached. The French toast didn't even seem like there was an egg batter on it. We discussed this with the manager and he offered to have our food redone but the food took a while to get to our table already, so we didn't want to wait. So we said it was ok and to just let the kitchen know. We also had to stop the manager to ask for coffee refills because our server disappeared after taking our order. We will stick to their seafood menu and avoid the brunch all together.

This used to be a great place for seafood. After many years the quality has diminished. This was the best seafood in Corpus. Not so much anymore. Service is excellent but does not make up for poor quality of food. Total bummer
Very nice place! Definitely reccomend. Great oysters and nice wait staff. Good sushi selection as well. The menu looks good and we enjoyed it very much

Love this place! We had the queso and chips. It was so good and had a twist to it. The fries were thin and scrumptious. The burgers were  cooked a little to well for me. So be sure to specify. Ample seating..love the people.  Warm friendly and just a neat place to go. We missed the live music.. and it was cold but the have the heaters and the area was perfect. It is a must down town.

If you’re visiting from out of town, The Executive Surf Club, is local restaurant that provides live music and relaxing beach vibe. There is indoor and outdoor seating. There is a child’s menu and they’re pet friendly! The Scarecrow People are a must see! The menu is pretty good and decently priced. On Monday nights the host “Geeks Who Drink”, tons of fun if you’re into trivia.
Venue was awesome and live band performance was so much fun. Great beer selection inside but not great service. A lot of fun for a new experience.

Very fun bar and American restaurant with a ton of beers on tap. They've got a good kitchen too, I really liked my Southwest burger, and the fries are excellent. If you have a dog you can sit outside on their porch area and listen to the live music as well.

I’m guessing this place is hyped-up as a ‘Corpus Classic’, and by classic meaning “subpar food pretending to be good food”

1. If I bring the chips back because they weren’t cooked all the way, don’t send them back to me a minute shy of being burnt..

2. If you’re going to fry food, you might as well use fresh oil. Our fries, onion rings, chips, and pickles all tasted of burnt, rancid oil..

3. If you’re going to put a menu above your register, maybe advertise all your menu items?..

Maybe all this was a factor of it being a Sunday? Maybe it was a bad staff? Maybe it’s the weather?

Maybe it’s me. But when the food is so bad it makes your beer taste bad... the restaurant is headed in a bad direction.

1 Star- Justified by the restaurant’s lackluster performance and underwhelming experience.
